verses.text: Of these \add things\add* be not thou ashamed, And accept no person to sin \add thereby:\add*
Of the law of the most High, and \add his\add* covenant; And of judgment to justify the ungodly;
Of reckoning with \add thy\add* partners and travellers; Or of the gift of the heritage of friends;
Of exactness of balance and weights; Or of getting much or little;
And of merchants’ indifferent selling; Of much correction of children; And to make the side of an evil servant to bleed.
Sure keeping \add is\add* good, where an evil wife is; And shut up, where many hands \add are\add*.
Deliver all \add things\add* in number and weight; And \add put\add* all in writing that thou givest out, or receivest in.

\add Be not ashamed\add* to inform the unwise and foolish, And the extreme aged that contendeth with \add those that are\add* young: Thus shalt thou be truly learned, And approved of all \add men\add* living.

The father waketh for the daughter, when no man knoweth; And the care for her taketh away sleep: When she is young, lest she pass away the flower of her age; And being married, lest she should be hated;

In \add her\add* virginity, lest she should be defiled And gotten with child in her father’s house; \add And\add* having a husband, lest she should misbehave herself; And when she is married, lest she should be barren.

Keep a sure watch over a shameless daughter, Lest she make thee a laughing-stock to \add thine\add* enemies, \add And\add* a byword in the city, and a reproach among the people, And make thee ashamed before the multitude.
Behold not every body’s beauty, And sit not in the midst of women.
For from garments cometh a moth, And from women wickedness.
Better \add is\add* the churlishness of a man than a courteous woman, A woman, \add I say\add*, which bringeth shame and reproach.
I will now remember the works of the Lord, And declare \add the things\add* that I have seen; In the words of the Lord \add are\add* his works.
The sun that giveth light looketh upon all \add things\add*, And the work thereof \add is\add* full of the glory of the Lord.
The Lord hath not given power to the saints to declare all his marvellous works, Which the Almighty Lord firmly settled, That whatsoever is might be established for his glory.
He seeketh out the deep, and the heart, And considereth their crafty devices; For the Lord knoweth all that may be known, And he beholdeth the signs of the world.
He declareth the \add things\add* that are past, and for to come, And revealeth the steps of hidden \add things\add*.
No thought escapeth him, Neither any word is hidden from him.

He hath garnished the excellent works of his wisdom, And he is from everlasting to everlasting: \add Unto him\add* may nothing be added, neither can he be diminished, And he hath no need of any counseller.
O how desirable \add are\add* all his works! And \add that a man\add* may see even to a spark.
All these \add things\add* live and remain for ever For all uses, and they are all obedient.
All \add things are\add* double one against another: And he hath made nothing unperfect.
One \add thing\add* establisheth the good or another: And who shall be filled with beholding his glory?
